name: exuded
content:
Add to word list

past simple and past participle of
exude
exude verb [T]
(FEELING)
If you exude love, confidence, pain, etc., you show that you have a lot of that feeling: She just exudes confidence.

exude verb [T]
(LIQUID/SMELL)
to produce a smell or liquid substance from inside: Some trees exude from their bark a sap that repels insect parasites.
